SENT.plain: Horner syndrome, in which ptosis, miosis, and anhidrosis occur concomitantly, can arise from injury to the sympathetic nerve pathways anywhere from the brain to the end organs
Incomplete Horner syndrome lacks the sign of anhidrosis

We present a case of incomplete Horner syndrome caused by internal carotid artery dissection and provide a road map of the cervical sympathetic nerves involved in Horner syndrome to explain its etiology
We also discuss the imaging of and therapy for internal carotid artery dissections
